EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
WESTROCK CP, L.L.C (WESTROCK)
PANAMA CITY MILL
 
Corporate Policies
 
There are written WestRock Corporate Safety Guidelines and Programs that all facilities must follow. The guidelines also describe senior management's commitment to safety. The safety guidelines assign the responsibility and authority to the management team at each facility for conducting an effective safety program. 
 
Panama City Mill Policy- 

January 12, 2022:  Update to RMP Plan for removal of chlorine as a covered chemical.  Water disinfection chemical was changed to sodium hypochlorite in December 2021.  Below summary updated to remove mention of chlorine.
 
It is the policy of WestRock Panama City Mill to conduct its business to insure the likelihood of a release of chlorine dioxide is reduced and if there is a release, the offsite consequence will be minimized. The chlorine dioxide system is maintained according to good engineering and maintenance practices. Our operating and maintenance employees utilizing the chlorine dioxide system have been trained in the safe handling and use of chlorine dioxide.
 
It is the policy of WestRock to promote employee participation in all programs, including the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) and OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) program.
 
Description of Panama City Operations
 
WestRock's Panama City facility is an integrated pulp and paper mill that produces Kraft linerboard and Bleached Market Pulp. Finished products are shipped via rail, truck and ship to customers all over the world. 
 
Description of RMP-Covered Processes
 
Chlorine Dioxide - Bleaching
 
Chlorine dioxide is generated on site in a process using sodium chlorate and methanol in a strong sulfuric acid solution. Chlorine dioxide is removed, as generated, by vacuum and absorbed in cold water (38-40 F) to a concentration of 9 to 10 grams/liter.  The chlorine dioxide solution is stored for use in several bleaching stages throughout the Bleac

h Plant. 
 
Five-Year Accident History
 
There have been no releases of chlorine dioxide that meet the reporting requirements of the RMP rule in the last five years  (2017-2021).
 
General Accidental Release Prevention Program
 
Chlorine Dioxide-Bleaching
 
WestRock, Panama City has an OSHA PSM program in place covering its chlorine dioxide operations. This PSM Level 3 Prevention Program meets the requirements of EPA's RMP rule and is utilized as the accident prevention section of the Panama City facility's RMP.
 
General Accidental Release Prevention Activities at the Mill
 
The mill has a staff of experienced and knowledgeable employees that receive safety and environmental training annually on numerous EPA and OSHA related programs. Each employee working with chlorine dioxide has experience and training in the hazards associated with this chemical.   The chlorine dioxide generator system is manned 24 hours a day by experienced operators that are knowledgeable in the emergency shut down procedures necessary to mitigate releases to the environment.

Emergency Response Program

The mill has a trained Emergency Response Team that is qualified at the Haz-Mat Technician level.  These employees will respond to an emergency release of chlorine dioxide. Annual confined space rescue and Haz-Mat training for the Emergency Response Team was last conducted in August 2021.

In the event of  possible offsite consequence from the release of chlorine dioxide, the Bay County Emergency Management Center will be notified by calling 911. Bay County Emergency Management Agency has been informed of the use of a 244,000-gallon tank of a water solution of chlorine dioxide.
 
Initial response to a 911 call will come from the City of Springfield Fire Department. If the incident requires additional equipment or manpower, the Springfield Fire Department will call the Bay County Emergency Management Agency for the needed support.
 
The mill has a written Emergency Resp

onse Plan and there are copies maintained throughout the mill.  
 
Any event involving a release of chlorine dioxide will be investigated by a qualified team and a root cause will be determined. An incident investigation team comprised of Safety Department personnel, production management and hourly operators will be formed.  All findings and recommendations of the investigative team will be presented to facility management and promptly addressed.
 
The Bay County Emergency Management Agency and local responding Fire Department are given the opportunity to inspect the site and make recommendations for inclusion in the Risk Management Program development. These agencies are invited to familiarize their teams with the facility on an annual basis.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The recent change to sodium hypochlorite from gaseous chlorine in the raw water disinfection process is a major improvement for the safety of both our employees and the surrounding community.

The WestRock Company's Safety Code of Conduct states, in part, "We hold safety and health as our highest core value." The Panama City mill is constantly improving upon its safety program. A monthly Safety and Housekeeping Calendar ensures all safety systems are maintained in the highest level of effectiveness and preparedness.  We have instituted Safety Thursdays where all maintenance work is aimed at safety work orders in a particular department. We have also added personnel from the hourly ranks as Safety Advocates in a full-time position.  We have added another safety professional to our Safety Department to assist with the daily management of our safety programs.  As process and systems change, so does our methodology for protecting our employees. The safety of our employees is our number one priority. As a residual effect, our neighbors in the community and the surrounding area benefit. Less likelihood of problems within the mill means less likelihood of problems for our neighbors. We w

ill continue to find ways to actively engage our work force in the safety process and continue our Behavior-Based safety observation program. We have created a new observation form to assist all employees in documenting their safety observations.  It's a pocket sized card that walks the employee through the "Take Two" steps to review jobs prior to commencement.  Our mill remains one of the best in our Division for safety related metrics.
